quotes.quote: The human race is governed by its imagination.
Racism does not have a good track record. It's been tried out for a long time and you'd think by now we'd want to put an end to it instead of putting it under new management.
Racial superiority is a mere pigment of the imagination.
Racists believe that national identity is determined by racial purity.
Color can be measured in the depth of ones' skin, however character is measured by the content of ones' heart.
The human race may be the only intelligent beings in the galaxy.
Race determines variables that yield results undesirable to one sector, while rendering a noticeable favor to others.
Race is the least reliable information you can have about someone. It's real information, but it tells you next to nothing.
Race doesn't really exist for you because it has never been a barrier. Black folks don't have that choice.
It is not our differences that divide us. It is our inability to recognize, accept, and celebrate those differences.
A race is a work of art that people can look at and be affected in as many ways they're capable of understanding.
Racial prejudices are indication of a disturbed and potentially unstable society.
The human race is evolving to the realization that what is happening on the level of consciousness both precedes and determines what happens in the world.
Lets us not be divided by the color of our skin, but be united by the color of our blood.
Race does not determine the intelligent coefficient.
Real cultural diversity results from the interchange of ideas, products, and influences, not from the insular development of a single national style.
A racially integrated community is a chronological term timed from the entrance of the first black family to the exit of the last white family.
There really is for humankind there's really no such thing as race. There's different tribes but not different races. We're all one species.
Racial justice is key to a compassionate, inclusive, dynamic society.
A racial or religious or tribal identity is a kind of fact.
No human race is superior; no religious faith is inferior. All collective judgments are wrong. Only racists make them.
A racial community provides not only a sense of identity, that luxury of looking into another's face and seeing yourself reflected back, but a sense of security and support.
